name: Cabanas Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Cabanas Tulum (the older side, not the more luxurious The Beach) for several nights and loved it. We had a beach front room that was literally on the beach. Two steps from our porch and we were on the sand. We came for the beach and that is what we got. It was perfect for us.
reviews.title: Beach front :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was reasonably nice - basic, but comfortable. Everything was very clean, the AC worked, we had plenty of hot water. It would have been nice if there had been a stand for the suitcase and a little more room for shampoo and things in the shower, but otherwise it was great. The decor is a bit stark, which isn't my personal style, but it was fine. We weren't there to hang out in our room anyway. We did spend a fair amount of time on our porch though - which was great. It overlooked the beach and the sea, had 2 comfortable chairs, a small table, and a hammock.
reviews.title: 3 days of bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was wonderful - soft sand, beautiful water, a group of palms to provide shade on the beach, plenty of lounge chairs and hammocks. Pure heaven. The hotel is in a line of small hotels, many with bars and restaurants, and it was nice to stroll up the beach, stoping for a drink or a snack here and there and to play in the water.
reviews.title: go for a week or a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had several meals and quite a few drinks at El Bistro at Ziggy Beach - this is the restaurant and beach club attached to the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Trip Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the room rate and is the most generous included hotel breakfast that I had ever found. In most hotels it is a continental breakfast with perhaps the option to purchase a hot breakfast - here the breakfast is anything breakfast entre on the menu, a hot beverage (coffee, tea, etc.) and a cold beverage (juice, liquados, etc.).
reviews.title: Returned for our eighth time to Cabanas Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in the simpler rooms at Cabanas Tulum and for what we we're looking for it was a great place to stay. It was inexpensive, on the beach, and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. The food was pretty good at the hotel and they included a large breakfast in our hotel room cost which made it a great value! If you're looking for a low key, simple place to stay I'd highly recommend this spot.
reviews.title: Great visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week (March 2013) in the oceanfront room #23 and loved every minute of it. I had seen prevoius reviews so I had some expectations. We were greeted with friendly staff and a beautiful veiw. The beach there is amazing and not too crowded! My husband and I chose Tulum and Cabana's Tulum because we didn't want to be around a lot of people. The hotel beach had lots of hammocks, beach mattresses, and chairs. By the afternoon most mattresses were taken, but we always had one. There was a beautiful pool, but we never used it since we prefere the ocean. Our room was simple, clean, comfortable, and functional. The bed was pretty comfortable with exception of the sheets not being the best quaility. The staff (including The Bistro staff) were all friendly and willing to help in any way. There was always hot water for showering, but a little tricky to adjust. There was no cell service or televsion, but there was poor internet. The food at The Bistro was great, but a little expensive. We ate a wonderful breakfast every day there since it came with the room and ate there for some other meals too. We can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Cabanas Tulum and absolutely love it. The view to the ocean is incredible. The rooms are very simple, yet perfect for getting away from the world and relaxing. We walked up and down the beach to compare other hotels and cabanas, and Cabanas Tulum is certainly among the best on the beach.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another 10 days at this hotel ... some changes since we were there two years ago, for the better. Love the new section and will stay there next time ... we'll definitely go back, especially in light of our treatment this trip ... while things seemed not quite as good at first, one small complaint made a huge difference and we were treated like royalty ... the staff more than made up for one faux pas, thanks to Jose, the manager we dealt with through the restaurant. Great food, great service and a lot of fun evenings, in particular tequila tasting night ... what a blast. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay a good one, and it was, in spite of catching a cold and injuring myself while there ... can't think of a better place to feel poorly in ... they brought breakfast to our room for me, and even had help for my sunburn. Thanks to Jose, Jorge, Abraham, Lorenzo, Nestor, Candy and Jose Luis and all the other great service people we dealt with ... Love this place!!!
reviews.title: another great visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel frequently, especially to Caribbean sort of locations. I did a lot of research, and was very nervous about staying in Tulum (worried it was a little too eco-friendly for me), and about not going all-inclusive and having to find all our own food and activities. I was blown away by how much we LOVED this hotel, as well as the area. This is one of our favorite vacations we have taken. It floors me that people can find such minor things to complain about here. We booked a deluxe beachfront room. It was beautiful. The huge windows/doors looking into the ocean was the most gorgeous view to wake up to each morning. The patio space was great, and very functional with a couch, hammock, and dining table. The natural beauty of the outdoors brought in, as well as touches like gorgeous woods and stone throughout the room...no complaints there. The bed was very comfortable. I was expecting a rock! Towels were replinished every day. We never got hot and only used the AC one night. Most nights we slept with the doors open, and the screens shut. No bugs in room. Only didn't have hot water one night. The front desk is close-by to pick up new beach towels and breakfast tickets. You can get them the night before if you don't want to go by in the am. No big deal. The pool area is very nice. The addition of the new decking makes a huge difference. The beach beds were always available, including shady spots. Beach service was great. EVERY employee at the hotel was beyond friendly, and went out of their way to make us comfortable and happy. The free breakfast had lots of choices, and we were always full. The lunch and dinner was great there as well. A few times, we had them deliver food to our room (who can beat eating on your own private balcony on the ocean?). For our anniversary, they decorated the bed with petals, brought our breakfast to our room with roses, and left us a bottle of champagne. When I had problems with things I booked, they gave good advice and even let me use their personal cell phones to call the company. I have no reservations recommending this place. The waiter for our last breakfast even made us a beautiful flower arrangement. The bartender made my husband an awesome coconut drink, then cracked it open, carved out the coconut and showed him a special way to eat it with spices and lime (then did it AGAIN two nights later). Even though our week was windy, then chilly, we had one of the best trips we've ever had. When asked at check-out if I had any suggestions, the only thing I could even think of is a foot bath for the upstairs rooms to keep sand off the floors. (Even so, the maid service got it all up daily). My husband said it'd be nice to have a small fridge, which is true (we bought a styrofoam cooler, but the ice completely melted every day). I hope that one day I get to go back here.
reviews.title: One of the best places we've stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My (now) husband and I were married in Tulum on February 16th, and we had a tough time finding a hotel for our guests that would meet all of their requirements (beach front, air conditioning, electricity, good service, etc.). I cannot stress enough how happy we are with our decision to use Cabanas Tulum as our main guest hotel. The hotel hosted 24 of our guests in every room category, and every single guest was happy with the hotel. Most of our guests stayed for one week, and at least two of our guests have already rebooked for next year.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel for us and our wedding guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beginning with our room, we booked a Beachfront Deluxe Superior Room for a week. The room is quite spacious, and it was the perfect size to host guests coming in and out of our room. My parents booked the same room category, and it managed to fit me, my six bridesmaids, a hair stylist, a photographer, and four other people for our wedding day preparations! The bed was quite comfortable, and it was such a luxury to walk right onto the beach from our balcony doors. I was a little nervous about the lack of air conditioning during the day, but it really was not a problem. Tulum is breezy, so the wind naturally cools your room.
reviews.title: Cabanas Tulum Feb 26 -March 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was quite spacious with two sinks and a separate toilet area. You can borrow a hair dryer from the front desk, and the electricity system had no problem with handling curling irons. One small suggestion - there is a glass wall on the front of the bathroom, which looks out onto the pool area. The shower is also glass. Although some of the glass has a smoke tint to it, it was relatively easy to see into the bathrooms. We hung a towel on a hook outside the shower to provide us with a little more privacy, but this may be something for the hotel to look into. Also, on two occasions, we had no hot water for our shower. I think we were taking showers at peak times (i.e., right before dinner), and we did not experience any issues at any other time. Just something to keep in mind.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony on the top floor had spectacular views. We were in room 201, which was adjacent to the second floor stairs for the other section of the hotel. For those of you who would like some privacy while on your roof top, you may want to request another room. The hotel has placed a fence by the stairs, but we didn't feel like we had as much privacy as the other rooftops (which have complete privacy based on the Beachfront Deluxe rooms booked by four other couples in our wedding group). Regardless, it was incredibly peaceful to lay on the rooftop couches and see the beautiful stars each night.
reviews.title: Great value and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and wine at the hotel were quite tasty! After a week of hosting guests (and reviewing our food and bar tabs as well as the tabs that our guests discussed with us), I really believe the food, wine, and alcohol were reasonably priced. Our non-sun-loving guests were planted in the bar each day, and everyone agreed that the costs were not exorbitant. The Malbec wine by the glass was delicious, and I will forever dream of the shrimp tacos at the hotel's restaurant. The breakfast was also amazing every morning.
reviews.title: Paradise In Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Cabanas Tulum in October 2010, and we're still trying to top it!
reviews.title: It's been over two years but still think about cabanas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is hard to imagine a more friendly, beautiful, simple (in the best way) and centring place than cabanas Tulum.
reviews.title: It grows on you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travellers be warned, if you want flat screen TVs, DVD players, computers, video games, blaring music, pool games, and all that stuff the big hotels think we need, DO NOT go to cabanas Tulum! It's ain't there folks. If you want a place to be calm, breath in the cleanest air you've ever smelled, eat fresh seafood right from the boat, and swim in the moonlight on powder white sand go to cabanas Tulum!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went with three kids (9, 7, 1) and they loved it just as much as we did. I can't wait to return and fancy checking out the new beach hotel rooms (my wife prefers the more rustic originals).
reviews.title: Lots of amenities for Eco-chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough about the staff (be warned they love kids and will make off with your babies making coo coo sounds to them, until you're ready for them to come back), the location, the beach, the feeling of the place. It is almost perfect. Plus it is only a super cheap cab ride from the town of Tulum and lots of natural activities.
reviews.title: Recommended retreat in relaxing Tulum

description: Cabanas Tulum Hotel is located on a large stretch of beautiful beach, surrounded by coconut trees, and the turquoise sea. It’s the perfect place to relax and reunite with nature. All of our front row rooms have breathtaking sea views from the small terrace, while our second row rooms are only a few steps away from the beach.
